content: For example, if I have a Patient with an ID = 1234, is there an easy way to query using the search API and get all resources that reference Patient 1234? In the docs I see that the resource type has to be specified (ie. /Observation?subject.id=1234), but I was wondering if there was a way to easily do this without knowing the resource type that references Patient 1234. Thanks!

It occurred to me that this question ties into the same query that came up in a separate discussion of referential integrity - there was the idea of making an extended operation Resource/$referred-to that would return all the incoming references to a resource, in a searchset, with pagination. This doesn't exist today but it sounded like a good idea.
